main event: A single object, round on top and coming to a point at the bottom, the size of a basketball, was observed in the sky over Richmond, Virginia on April 21, 1956.
interesting points: The object was a light, translucent silvery color and appeared to be a balloon.
The object moved slowly to the east at a high altitude and gradually disappeared.
The object was observed through two telescopes, one of 35 power.
A light aircraft was sent to 6,000 feet to observe the object, but it did not seem any closer than when viewed from the ground.
An F-94C fighter jet made a short search of the area with negative results.
sighted object: a single, round object with a pointed bottom, silvery in color
witnesses: five civilian observers and two military observers
